metadata.title: Piper PA-46
aws::graph::propositions: Piper PA-46R-350T Matrix Aircraft Specifications
Piper announced the Matrix in October 2007.
The Matrix is an unpressurized version of the Mirage.
The Matrix is designated as the PA-46R-350T.
The PA-46R-350T designation indicates retractable landing gear.
The PA-46R-350T designation indicates 350 horsepower (260 kW).
The PA-46R-350T designation indicates turbocharging.
Piper Aircraft marketed the Matrix as a cabin-class aircraft.
The Matrix was marketed for Cirrus SR-22 owners to step up to.
The Matrix was marketed for Cessna 400 owners to step up to.
The Matrix includes a built-in oxygen system as standard equipment.
The Matrix includes an Avidyne Entegra glass cockpit as standard equipment.
The Matrix includes an S-Tec 55X autopilot as standard equipment.
The Matrix includes air conditioning as standard equipment.
A de-ice system is a major option on the Matrix.
An "Enhanced Situational Awareness Package" is a major option on the Matrix.
Speed brakes are a major option on the Matrix.
An avionics package featuring the Avidyne TAS610 dual antenna traffic advisory system is a major option on the Matrix.
GWX-68 Weather Radar is a major option on the Matrix.
The Garmin G1000 avionics system became a major option on the Matrix beginning in 2010.
The Garmin G1000 avionics system includes twin 10" Primary Flight Displays (PFDs).
The Garmin G1000 avionics system includes a 15" Multi-Function Display (MFD).

text:
### PA-46R-350T Matrix

In October 2007 Piper announced the Matrix, an unpressurized version of the Mirage. The new model was designated as the PA-46R-350T, indicating retractable landing gear, 350 horsepower (260 kW), and turbocharging.
Piper Aircraft marketed the Matrix as a cabin-class aircraft for Cirrus SR-22 and Cessna 400 owners to step up to. Standard equipment on the Matrix includes a built-in oxygen system, Avidyne Entegra glass cockpit, S-Tec 55X autopilot and air conditioning.
Major options on the Matrix included a de-ice system, an "Enhanced Situational Awareness Package", speed brakes, an avionics package featuring the Avidyne TAS610 dual antenna traffic advisory system, GWX-68 Weather Radar, and, beginning in 2010, the Garmin G1000 avionics system with twin 10" PFD's and a 15" MFD.
